newsitem.title: BRAZIL: U.S. toy industry rep meets Brazilian officials.
newsitem.headline: U.S. toy industry rep meets Brazilian officials.

text.p: The president of the Toy Manufacturers of America association (TMA) met Brazilian officials Friday for talks over a recent move by Brazil raising import tariffs to 70 percent from 20 percent, officials said.
A spokeswoman for the Ministry of Industry and Commerce said David Miller held talks with the director of the ministry's Trade Defence Department, Armando Meziat, in Rio de Janeiro.
Neither Miller nor Meziat could be reached for comment.
U.S. toy manufacturers, including Barbie doll manufacturer Mattel Inc, have criticized the increased tariffs.

The "safeguard" against excessive toy imports principally affects China, which accounted for $103.3 million of total toy imports in 1995 of $284.38 million. That total was up sharply from $103.96 million the previous year.
Taiwan accounted for $41.89 million in imports and the United States for $29.12 million, according to Brazilian government figures.
